00320 // These are ugly, but necessary utility functions we must use to generate a
00321 // unique identifier inside of the PARAM() module.
00322 #define JOIN(x, y) JOIN_AGAIN(x, y)
00323 #define JOIN_AGAIN(x, y) x ## y

00340 #ifdef __COUNTER__
00341   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::io::Option<T> \
00342       JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __COUNTER__) \
00343       (false, DEF, ID, DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00344 
00346   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static mlpack::io::Option<bool>\
00347   JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __COUNTER__) (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00348 
00350 #else
00351   // We have to do some really bizarre stuff since __COUNTER__ isn't defined.  I
00352   // don't think we can absolutely guarantee success, but it should be "good
00353   // enough".  We use the __LINE__ macro and the type of the parameter to try
00354   // and get a good guess at something unique.
00355   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::io::Option<T> \
00356       JOIN(JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __LINE__), opt) (false, DEF, ID, \
00357       DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00358 
00360   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static mlpack::io::Option<bool>\
00361       JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __LINE__) (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00362 
00364 #endif
